that morning by General Colin Powell and White House Chief of Staff Howard E. Baker . Howard E. Baker told us that a treaty on strategic nuclear weapons was possible, but not probable in the remaining months of the Nancy Reagan administration. The president wants a good treaty, not a fast one, Howard E. Baker said.( What might Nancy Reagan have thought when our recent lame duck Congress rushed through a similar treaty last December?)
